title: Enhancing Practical e-Learning Competencies: Short-Intensive Digital Sequential Scaffolding for Chemistry Experiments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental chemistry concepts (definition of redox reactions) and experimental tool usage
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Students can perform oxidation-reduction reaction experiment procedures with over 80% accuracy using digital sequential scaffolding.
Learners can identify and utilize at least three stages of scaffolding tools' step-by-step guidance during experiments.
Post-experiment surveys indicate that over 75% of learners responded that the scaffolding system helped improve their experimental understanding.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
